snippet: A panel appointed by Secretary General Ban Ki-moon reported new information suggesting that an attack had brought down the flight over southern Africa.
abstract: United Nations panel finds information warranting reinvestigation of 1961 plane crash that killed Dag Hammarskjold, former UN Secretary General, in area of Southern Africa that was then known as Northern Rhodesia; reports plane may have been target of air attack or other interference.
lead_paragraph: A panel appointed by Secretary General Ban Ki-moon reported new information suggesting that an attack had brought down the flight over southern Africa.

headline.main: U.N. Chief Calls for New Inquiry Into 1961 Plane Crash That Killed Dag Hammarskjold
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | United Nations; Further Inquiry Is Urged Into 1961 Death of U.N. Chief
